result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane Thomas Ploof

records.addlTxt: 8:37 AM Defendant Shane Thomas Ploof appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by video for Shane Thomas Ploof.  Prosecuting Attorney David S Olson in court for State of Wisconsin. Remand to Branch 7 for scheduling .
Calendar call on September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:56 AM Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shane Thomas Ploof appeared by video, in custody at the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for Shane Thomas Ploof. Scheduling order to be prepared.
Status conference on August 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.

02:31 PM Defendant Shane Thomas Ploof in court by video means, in custody at the Rock County Jail.  Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant to contact Pulic Defender's Office.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Activity: initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:34 PM Defendant Shane Thomas Ploof in court in custody appearing by video with attorney Walter H Isaacson also appearing by video.  David Zarwell   and intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video  for the State of Wisconsin. Address verified.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.   Signature bond set of $500.00   with conditions, Maintain absolute sobriety. No possession of a controlled substance without a valid prescription. Must remain in residence from 6pm to 6am unless at work or traveling to or from work. No contact with Walmart. Not guilty plea entered by attorney, remand to branch 7 for scheduling.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report

Maintain absolute sobriety. No possession of a controlled substance without a valid prescription. Must remain in residence from 6pm to 6am unless at work or traveling to or from work. No contact with Walmart.
